categoriesExplanation:
The workout title and description highlight a 'Lower Body Circuit,' which suggests a focus on leg exercises performed in a circuit fashion. The mention of 'mat' in the description aligns well with the 'Mat' category, indicating exercises likely performed on the floor without significant equipment, justifying a strong score of 0.8. 

The workout also includes intervals on the 'Hydrow,' a brand of rowing machine, signaling a component of rowing, thus fitting the 'Indoor rowing' category. However, since it's combined with other exercises, it receives a moderate score of 0.6.

Finally, the format 'AMRAP' (as many reps as possible) and mention of 'circuit' suggest a high-intensity or interval nature to the workout, corresponding with the 'HIIT' category, meriting a score of 0.6 as well. While the workout incorporates cardio, it doesn't fit indoor biking, elliptical, or treadmill because of the rowing and mat focus, excluding other similar aerobic categories.
